title: Loch Duntelchaig Walking Route

images.title: Old Township above Loch Duntelchaig by valenta, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old Township above the loch

description: This walk visits Loch Duntelchaig in Inverness-shire in the Scottish Highlands. The scenic freshwater lake is also the primary reservoir for Inverness. At the south western end of the loch you can follow a country lane to the ancient hut circles which sit on the western side above the water. It's a lovely peaceful place with fine views over the water to the surrounding hills. The loch is just to the east of Loch Ness so it's easy to continue your waterside walking in the area. You can visit Dores Beach on the eastern side or pick up the epic Great Glen Way on the western side of the world famous loch. The lovely RSPB nature reserve at Loch Ruthven is also just a mile to the south. It's an excellent place for wildlife with Slavonian grebes, osprey and black-throated divers to see.
